utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: What about an antidote? There has to be an antidote.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: The only existing vial was stolen with the toxin.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They can make more, right? They have to be able to make more.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It would take too long to synthesize.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How long?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A week.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s too long. Are you sure I was exposed? I mean, I feel fine. Maybe they were wrong.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, there’s a doctor coming in from Walter Reed. He’s going to be able to answer any other questions you might have.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I think you already did that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. We’re going to find whoever’s behind this. And when we do we’re going to get that antidote, because I’m not letting you out of our engagement that easily.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. So, where are you in the investigation?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re looking into every possible lead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s what you say when you’re nowhere!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The guy who abducted me –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bronson.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. Was he military? Special ops?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Marine force recon, why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, because before he died he said something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Valkyrie, yeah. We’ve been looking into it. There’s nothing in the databases –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not that. He said something about “Dreamworld”. Now I didn’t think it was anything, but according to Esposito, Dreamworld is the code name of a special ops ghost base somewhere in the Middle East.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you think that somehow relates to the theft of the toxin?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I … think … Bronson thought it did.

utterance.speaker: DOCTOR GOLDBERG
utterance.content: Sorry to interrupt. I’m Doctor Goldberg, here to check on Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: RACHEL MCCORD
utterance.content: How’s he doing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Better than I am. Where are we?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Well, we know whoever’s behind this framed Jack Bronson for the break in and then used the toxin to kill him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means they would have had to cross paths with him in order to deliver it.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Exactly. Hendricks and his team are retracing all of Bronson’s movements to get a who and a when. It’s a needle in a haystack, but maybe we’ll get lucky.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anything on Valkyrie?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Nothing that connects. Analysts are still working on it, thought.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Have you ever heard of something called Dreamworld?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: What’s Dreamworld?

utterance.speaker: GOLDBERG
utterance.content: The pralidoxime and atropine will stave off the effect of the toxin and buy you some more time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How much more?

utterance.speaker: GOLDBERG
utterance.content: An hour, maybe two. I’ll give you another shot every four hours, but eventually it won’t be effective.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And then what?

utterance.speaker: GOLDBERG
utterance.content: Towards the end you’ll start to feel weak, experience shortness of breath.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why did Bronson die so quickly and I’m still alive?

utterance.speaker: GOLDBERG
utterance.content: Bronson was in the car for hours so he got the motherlode. You were in the car just for a few minutes. Ingested in liquid form you go down in seconds, but based on your blood work you have at least another ten to twelve hours.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So then, apart from the part where I’m dying, I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: GOLDBERG
utterance.content: You’re asymptomatic. I’ll try to keep you that way for as long as possible.

utterance.speaker: CHIEF CARL VILANTE
utterance.content: A ghost base in the Middle East?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, I know this is a longshot, but Bronson may have been trying to communicate a message.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Or it’s just the ramblings of a dying man. Look, we checked the government and military databases. There’s no official mention of Dreamworld. If it even exists.

utterance.speaker: AGENT RICHMOND
utterance.content: Uh, I think it exists.

utterance.speaker: VILANTE
utterance.content: What did you find?

utterance.speaker: RICHMOND
utterance.content: A name just popped in a Pentagon archive. Brad Parker. A reported for the Washington Union.

utterance.speaker: VILANTE
utterance.content: What’s a reporter got to do with this?

utterance.speaker: RICHMOND
utterance.content: Six months ago he tried to publish an article called “Inside Dreamworld”, but it was quashed over security concerns.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What does the article say?

utterance.speaker: RICHMOND
utterance.content: I don’t have the text. They’ve classified it. I have the title.

utterance.speaker: VILANTE
utterance.content: I’ll call my contact at the Pentagon, see what he can dig up. In the meanwhile, track down this reporter, find out what he knows.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You could also check Bronson’s phone records. He and this reporter might be connected.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you should be resting.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s plenty of time for that later, apparently. Um, if it’s all the same I’d rather be helping.

utterance.speaker: VILANTE
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, I understand your desire to be involved, but –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No one is more motivated than me to solve this. And if it doesn’t work out, I’ll be out of your hair by the end of the day.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, sir, Castle’s the only one who has firsthand experience with Bronson. He might be an asset.

utterance.speaker: VILANTE
utterance.content: Okay. But Agent Beckett, he’s your responsibility.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: RICHMOND
utterance.content: Sir? It looks like Bronson and the reporter are connected. His phone records show calls to and from the Washington Union around the time the article was written.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Bronson must have been a source for the article.

utterance.speaker: VILANTE
utterance.content: Go. Find out what he knows.

utterance.speaker: VILANTE
utterance.content: Ah, Mr. Castle. You can assist us, but only from inside this building.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, uh … thanks for backing me up with Castle.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Is he always such a character?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s one of the things that I love about him, too.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: There.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Parker! Mr. Parker, excuse me. We’re from the Attorney General’s office. We need to ask you a few questions about an article you wrote, “Inside Dreamworld”.

utterance.speaker: BRAD PARKER
utterance.content: Really, we’re going to do this again? You people are unbelievable.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: PARKER
utterance.content: I wouldn’t give up my sources when you killed the article. So why would I give them up now?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because it looks like one of your sources was murdered.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Do you recognize him, Mr. Parker?

utterance.speaker: PARKER
utterance.content: Bronson. Wait, he was murdered?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. And now other people’s lives are at stake. Now tell us everything that you know about Dreamworld.

utterance.speaker: PARKER
utterance.content: First time I heard about Dreamworld was in ’03. I was serving with the 173rd in Kandahar at the time. The story stuck with me so about a year ago I started poking around. Found out it was a forward operating base in northern Afghanistan launching covert special ops in the region.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did Bronson work at that base?

utterance.speaker: PARKER
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, I’d heard his name a couple times so I approached him.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: And what did he tell you?

utterance.speaker: PARKER
utterance.content: Nothing at all. In fact, he seemed pretty freaked out that I knew he was stationed there. He asked me how much I knew, about him, Dreamworld. About what he’d done.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, wait. What did he mean by that?

utterance.speaker: PARKER
utterance.content: He never told me. Whatever it was he didn’t want it getting out. Next thing I know, my editor’s killing the story. At the personal request of Defense Secretary Reed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: These conversations that you had with Bronson, did he ever mention the word ‘Valkyrie’?

utterance.speaker: PARKER
utterance.content: No, why? What’s Valkyrie?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Wait … the Secretary of Defense himself called to kill the story? That’s unusual.

utterance.speaker: PARKER
utterance.content: Try unheard of. But I’m guessing that the subject matter struck a nerve. Look, prior to his appointment as the Secretary of Defense, General Reed was in charge of central command, which ran all missions out of Dreamworld.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you suggesting the Secretary of Defense is hiding something?

utterance.speaker: PARKER
utterance.content: You have another explanation?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So a stolen military toxin and a secret government base. I mean, what do you think this is all about?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: I don’t know, but I have a feeling Bronson did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where are we headed?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: To talk to the one person that might actually know what’s going on. Former commander of Dreamworld, Defense Secretary Reed.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Mr. Secretary.

utterance.speaker: DEFENSE SECRETARY REED
utterance.content: This must be damned important if the Attorney General’s personally asking me to take this meeting.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: It is. Three days ago a lethal toxin was stolen from a government lab. Our investigations led us to the murder of an ex-Marine Jack Bronson. Do you know him?

utterance.speaker: REED
utterance.content: It’s possible. A lot of men served under my command. Why? You think he was involved in this theft.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, but he may have known who was. We believe this is connected to a military base named Dreamworld.

utterance.speaker: REED
utterance.content: Well I hate to break it to you, but Dreamworld’s a myth. It’s a military legend. It doesn’t exist.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you kidding me? Are we actually going to play this game?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Sir –

utterance.speaker: REED
utterance.content: Agent Beckett, was it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whoever took that toxin, if they use it there will be mass casualties. So if you know something –

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Sir.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Someone was writing an article about Dreamworld. You personally had that story killed. Why?

utterance.speaker: REED
utterance.content: Why? Because the enemy reads newspapers. And there’s no way in hell I’m gonna risk American lives by handing out operational details about a special ops base. If such a base existed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about Bronson. What’s his connection to that base?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If it indeed does exist.

utterance.speaker: REED
utterance.content: Everything I’m about to say is off the books, are we clear.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: REED
utterance.content: Bronson was an outstanding Marine. But he only worked one mission out of there. A high value airstrike in Jalalabad that took out Anwar Zawahiri, Al-Qaeda’s number two.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: What was Bronson’s role?

utterance.speaker: REED
utterance.content: He was our man on the ground, set up in a nearby building. He reported when Zawahiri went in the house. Then when the airstrike was launched he painted the house with a laser to guide the missile.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did the word ‘Valkyrie’ have anything to do with this strike? Was it the name of a mission, or a code name?

utterance.speaker: REED
utterance.content: No. It’s not familiar. Look, that operation was a big win for us. It crippled Al-Qaeda’s entire command structure.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Was there any talk of Al-Qaeda retaliating?

utterance.speaker: REED
utterance.content: There was chatter. Always is. But we took out Zawahiri a year ago and they never hit us back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Unless they just did. And this is just the beginning.

utterance.speaker: VILANTE
utterance.content: I have Homeland tightening security at every likely D.C target: government buildings, tourist attractions, transit hubs.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: The bad news is the toxin’s versatile. It could be deployed through the ventilation system, it could contaminate a reservoir, it could be detonated with a bomb and release a toxic plume over the city. And if that happens we’d be dealing with a lot more than just a couple of deaths on our hands and - I am so sorry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, it’s your job. And if we stop the next attack, it might mean saving me. But if this is Al Qaeda retaliation, how do they know about Bronson?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He was on the ground during the airstrike. He might have been seen by locals or Zawahiri family members.

utterance.speaker: VILANTE
utterance.content: Well let’s check for any Zawahiri family members, friends, or associates in the D.C area. If Al-Qaeda is about to strike, they must have people on the ground.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: I’ll be in the tech room.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m okay. I – – it’s my mother. She’s been calling all morning. Can’t avoid her forever.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hello Mother. To what do I owe the pleasure?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Richard! You were ushered out of here last night like a common criminal, you don’t answer my calls, what the hell is going on?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, Mother, I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Dad, did they arrest you? Do you need us to bail you out?

utterance.speaker: PI
utterance.content: Ooh, what about a lawyer, Mr. C? I know a guy at the ACLU.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, please.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I just has some … uh, special knowledge of a case that Beckett’s working on. She had them send down an escort, that’s all.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh. Well thank God. Um … oh, Gina called this morning. She has a bunch of books to sign for some company VIPs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. Um … there’s in my office at the back bookcase. If I’m … … if I’m not there tomorrow she can come pick them up. And Mother? Thank you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: When’s he coming back?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let me talk to Alexis.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: He wants to talk to you, honey.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey Dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hopefully I’ll be back tomorrow morning. And um … you know I love you, right?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: GOLDBERG
utterance.content: It’s time for your next shot.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Already?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad? Everything okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. They’re calling me, so I have to go.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Okay. See you tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ll see you tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Did Dad sound weird to you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, we’ve got something.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Turns out you were right about Zawahiri’s family. We identified six members of his extended family living in the US. Four in California and two cousins living right here in DC.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We were in the process of running them down when Hendricks found this.

utterance.speaker: HENDRICKS
utterance.content: In reconstructing Bronson’s movements prior to his death, we were able to track him to here, a coffee shop in DuPont Circle. A few seconds after he leaves … this man follows him out.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: We’ve ID’d him as Waqas Rasheed, second cousin to Zawahiri.

utterance.speaker: HENDRICKS
utterance.content: And Agent Richmond is trying to track him down, but here’s what we know. He has duel American/Afghan citizenship, he’s a graduate engineering student at Georgetown.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And sir, he was in Jalalabad the night of the Zawahiri airstrike. Five of his other cousins were killed in the attack.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Burying that many family members, that could radicalize anyone.

utterance.speaker: RICHMOND
utterance.content: Got him. We got him. We have a live feed of Rasheed waling east on 14th Street between E and F.

utterance.speaker: VILANTE
utterance.content: Backpack.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Could be the toxin.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And the antidote.

utterance.speaker: VILANTE
utterance.content: Let’s move.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Stop!

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Stop!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Federal agent. Stop!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s not here. Where’s the toxin? Rasheed! Where’s the toxin?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if he doesn’t talk?

utterance.speaker: VILANTE
utterance.content: He’ll talk. They always do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if he doesn’t talk in time?

utterance.speaker: VILANTE
utterance.content: We have teams combing his apartment. If he has the toxin and the antidote, they’ll find them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks. For letting me be a part of this.

utterance.speaker: VILANTE
utterance.content: When you write your next novel, maybe you’ll find a place for a dashing Colombian American federal agent.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Consider it done.

utterance.speaker: VILANTE
utterance.content: Anything at Rasheed’s?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We went over every inch of his place and there is no sign of the antidote or the toxin. He may have hidden it somewhere …

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Either that, or it’s already out there, ready to be deployed.

utterance.speaker: VILANTE
utterance.content: Break him.

utterance.speaker: RASHEED
utterance.content: So why am I here? What’s this about, huh?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re related to Anwar Zawahiri, is that correct?

utterance.speaker: RASHEED
utterance.content: A man doesn’t choose his family, okay? I had nothing to do with Anwar or his beliefs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yet you were in Jalalabad the night that he died.

utterance.speaker: RASHEED
utterance.content: Yes, but not to see him. I have relatives there. I was spending time with them for Ramadan.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: I understand that five of your relatives were killed in that US missile strike.

utterance.speaker: RASHEED
utterance.content: And for that I blame Anwar and them for being with him. Now why am I here?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: You studied engineering. Specifically electrical system designs for commercial buildings.

utterance.speaker: RASHEED
utterance.content: You have a gift for making every fact sound sinister.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Well, you’d be able to break into a secure facility.

utterance.speaker: RASHEED
utterance.content: I didn’t break into anything. I want an attorney. I have a right to an attorney.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Enemy combatants don’t get attorneys. Or trials.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where is the toxin, Rasheed?

utterance.speaker: RASHEED
utterance.content: I don’t know what you’re talking about!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think you do. In fact, I know you do. This is Jack Bronson, former US Marine. He was in Jalalabad the night of the strike. And this is you, following him outside of a coffee shop. Three hours later he was dead. You’re not going to tell me that’s a coincidence.

utterance.speaker: RASHEED
utterance.content: This is about him? Well you have it wrong. I wasn’t following him. He was following me.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Why would he be following you?

utterance.speaker: RASHEED
utterance.content: He wanted to know if I had talked to anybody about our secret.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Your secret? What secret?

utterance.speaker: RASHEED
utterance.content: The night of the missile strike I was at my brother’s home, just a block away from Anwar’s. I heard the explosion. I ran out. The house was destroyed. I was the first one there, so I wanted to see if there were any survivors. And that’s … uh … that’s when I saw Bronson standing there in the rubble, holding a body.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whose body?

utterance.speaker: RASHEED
utterance.content: A young woman. One of the servants in the house. And when he saw me, he drew his gun. And I thought for sure I was a dead man. But then he spoke. And he knew my name, and where I lived, and what I did, and he told me that if I told anyone about what I had seen he would kill me. And then he left. With the body.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: He took away a dead servant’s body?

utterance.speaker: RASHEED
utterance.content: I’ve done my best to forget about it all. Until he found me in the coffee shop and he kept asking me, ‘who did you tell, why are they setting me up?’ and I swore to him I didn’t tell anybody. Okay, whatever is happening here, whatever is going on, I swear to you I have nothing to do with it.

utterance.speaker: VILANTE
utterance.content: So none of the intelligence agencies can link Rasheed to known Al-Qaeda elements. And he’s got a solid alibi for the night of the break in.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: He could still be involved. Is there any chatter about an imminent attack?

utterance.speaker: VILANTE
utterance.content: No more than usual. What’s your take on Rasheed?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t think he’s our guy.

utterance.speaker: VILANE
utterance.content: Based on?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: His story. I mean, he said that he saw Bronson carrying a servant girl’s body? I mean, the only way that he’d come up with a story like that was if it was true.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So aside from the name Valkyrie, which no one you’ve spoken to seems to know anything about, we pretty much have nothing. Which means I’m a dead man.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, Castle. Not nothing. We have what Bronson told you, what Rasheed told us. We know that this revolves around something that happened the night Zawahiri was killed. Something more than just the airstrike. Now what we have to do is figure out what it was.

utterance.speaker: VILANTE
utterance.content: I’ll have DOD send over the mission documents. Maybe something in there will help shed some light.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: These are the mission documents?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: Is there even a sentence that doesn’t have redactions?

utterance.speaker: RICHMOND
utterance.content: Not a complete one. Somebody is definitely trying to hide whatever went on here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Castle. This is … pointless.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can you do a word search for Valkyrie?

utterance.speaker: RICHMOND
utterance.content: It doesn’t appear in the document. Probably because it’s redacted.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. But what about a search for blacked out eight letter words the same length as Valkyrie?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD

utterance.content: Well, we both know it’s not that simple.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well … there’s going to be an investigation at least, right?

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: You want everything to be black or white, I get it. But in this town it rarely is. And to do this job you have to make peace with that.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: But hey, that was a hell of a hunch about Mrs. Reed.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: You should feel really good about this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, that was Castle.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: But you were smart enough to act on it. That was your call.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You backed me up without even knowing my play.

utterance.speaker: MCCORD
utterance.content: That’s what partners do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. That’s what partners do.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
